resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [C++][Gandiva] Compiled LLVM bitcode file path may result in libraries being non-relocatable

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   We were not running the pyarrow tests after installing the manylinux wheels, which can lead to uncaught issues, like: https://travis-ci.org/kszucs/crossbow/builds/484284104

kou commented on issue #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#issuecomment-458320352
 
 
   The change just for creating a configuration for custom path. This is enough just for testing. But it's not suitable for normal use.
   We can't change the default path yet. I think that we need a feature to customize the default path dynamically or finding the byte code path from the loaded shared library path or something.

kszucs commented on pull request #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#discussion_r251938953
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .travis.yml
 ##########
 @@ -189,6 +189,8 @@ matrix:
     - $TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR/ci/travis_script_python.sh 3.6
   - name: "[manylinux1] Python"
     language: cpp
+    env:
+    - PYTHON_VERSIONS=2.7,16 3.6,16
 
 Review comment:
   This will reduce the build times. There are nightly tests for all versions.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kszucs commented on issue #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#issuecomment-458674229
 
 
   @kou could You elaborate on customizing the default path dynamically? 
   
   If I understand correctly the second option is to maintain a list of default search paths relative to the gandiva binary (queried via `dladdr` or `boost::dll::program_location()`)?;
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#issuecomment-458727172
 
 
   > If I understand correctly the second option is to maintain a list of default search paths relative to the gandiva binary (queried via `dladdr` or `boost::dll::program_location()`)?
   
   Right. But it may be difficult. Because Gandiva may be built as a static library. (We may able to assume that Gandiva is built as a shared library in wheel.)
   
   This approach is popular on Windows. Many products search their configuration file by relative path from their DLL.
   But it's not popular on Linux.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#discussion_r252350889
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/setup.py
 ##########
 @@ -297,6 +297,10 @@ def _run_cmake(self):
                     move_shared_libs(build_prefix, build_lib, "plasma")
                 if self.with_gandiva:
                     move_shared_libs(build_prefix, build_lib, "gandiva")
+                    bytecode_files = glob.glob(pjoin(build_prefix, '*.bc'))
 
 Review comment:
   For the record, they are [_bitcode_](https://llvm.org/docs/BitCodeFormat.html) files, not _bytecode_.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3484: ARROW-4372: [Python] Run pyarrow tests in manylinux travis build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3484#discussion_r252350460
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_script_manylinux.sh
 ##########
 @@ -39,4 +44,21 @@ conda activate $CONDA_ENV_DIR
 
 pip install -q tensorflow
 pip install "dist/`ls dist/ | grep cp36`"
-python -c "import pyarrow; import tensorflow"
+popd
+
+# # Test optional dependencies and the presence of tensorflow
+python -c "
+import sys
+import pyarrow
+import pyarrow.orc
+import pyarrow.parquet
+import pyarrow.plasma
+import tensorflow
 
 Review comment:
   Aren't we crashy when Tensorflow is loaded in the same process?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description: We were not running the pyarrow tests after installing the manylinux wheels, which can lead to uncaught issues, like: [https://travis-ci.org/kszucs/crossbow/builds/484284104]
fields.summary: [C++] Embed precompiled bitcode in the gandiva library
